text: you can make better faster Decisions by
querying data easily in real time
imagine you're a game publisher you have
just launched a new online game that
seems to be a hit but now you want to
know which features are generating the
most Revenue your game is generating
vast amounts of usage data including the
features being used and revenue
generated by those features typically
loading up all this data into a data
warehouse and then running off reports
is a time-consuming process with aws's
tools you can easily take your game
usage data stream to Amazon S3 and load
it into redshift serverless thanks to
redshift's built-in data sharing
capabilities you can give access to your
development team to run any queries they
like without any data movement and you
can connect redshift directly into
quicksite with the power of quicksite Q
anyone on your marketing team can query
that data by asking questions in natural
language let's say you want to find your
most popular features that are
generating Revenue with quicksite Q you
can simply ask it show Revenue per
player by feature now it looks like it's
the Cooperative gameplay feature that's
generating the highest revenue per
player we could then use this
information to run more advertising that
emphasizes this feature you can expand
the question further to break it down by
geography when you do that you notice a
particularly High Revenue per player in
China but you don't yet have a Mandarin
language version of your game this
suggests that if you localize the game
into Mandarin you could drive more usage
in China leading to potentially higher
Revenue the end result being able to
query data easily and in real time
allows you to make better faster
decisions
